Key Arguments: The legislation is unnecessary as existing laws already address speech crimes like defamation and inciting violence.
The bill could be used to suppress lawful discussions on social issues.
The bill's primary purpose appears to be the suppression of political beliefs contrary to the government and global elites.
The threat of massive fines to private companies will lead to excessive censorship.
The definitions of harm in the bill are vague and subjective, potentially leading to misuse.
The bill could prevent legitimate debate and censor political views opposed to the ruling orthodoxy.
There is a lack of trust in leadership to use the bill justly without proper safeguards.
Main Themes: Censorship and suppression of political beliefs
